meanings.definition: To supply water to (a person, for example) in order to restore or maintain fluid balance.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun, she made sure to drink plenty of hydrating water.
meanings.sent2: I am hydrating my body by drinking a glass of water every hour.
meanings.sent3: The hydrating water bottle was her trusty companion during the hot summer days.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like hydrating rain, refreshing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The hydrating stream flowed gently through the meadow, quenching the thirst of all the animals.

meanings.definition: To cause to take up or combine with water.
meanings.sent1: The sponge was hydrating the spilled water on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: The plant roots are hydrating the nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The hydrating soap bubbles floated in the air, creating a magical scene.
meanings.sent4: His words were like hydrating drops, soothing her worries and fears.
meanings.sent5: The hydrating mist enveloped the forest, bringing life to every leaf and flower.
